channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Bright light shining into homes, 23rd June
item.description:
Large bright lights should be faced downwards instead of facing directly to people’s homes. Issue has been present since last year.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Townley Road, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Defective Street Light, 22nd June
item.description:
You still haven’t fixed despite saying you would. Complaint escalated to local Councillors. Highland Road at the junction with Broadway, Bexleyheath, asset ID number 1. Please see the attached picture and fix it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 74, Broadway, Barnehurst, Bexleyheath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped Items, 22nd June
item.description:
Cinema Public Car Park, 22 Broadway, Bexleyheath, DA6 7RB: Please could you ask your street cleaning contractor - Countrystyle to stop dumping their blue waste sacks and dumped shopping trolley’s outside of this car park - as seen in the attached picture. Quite frankly, it looks a mess, it attracts foxes and other vermin and is not a temporary dumping ground! Please remove these items and ask the contractor to stop leaving their rubbish here.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Broadway, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water from burst pipe next to 171 bus stop opposite fielding Street, 22nd June
item.description:
Burst water pipe leaking through paving slabs where 171 bus stop is on walworth road opposite fielding street. I saw it on 21st June at 7.15 pm

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 365, Walworth Road, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ongoing issue with noisy squatters, 22nd June
item.description:
The previous reports have been deleted with no action. Noisy squatters/guardians are living in the building in Rosina street, very disruptive for residents. Noise can go on until early hours of the morning and the start again before 7am.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Rosina Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Elevator, 22nd June
item.description:
The elevator in this building has been constantly having frequent issues, and now they have closed the lift because it is out of service. There has been no updates for the past 4 days.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Frampton Park Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cycle hangar destroyed, metal edges everywhere, 22nd June
item.description:
The cycle hangar has been destroyed by some significant force, it is at an angle so there are dangerous metal edges at head height across the pavement. It’s also totally open with sawn off metal inside and sharp edges everywhere at just the height a child would go and play with. It has been like this for a fortnight now and must be removed urgently. It must also then be replaced as soon as possible as we cannot lose bike storage.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Canada Estate, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 50, Eastbourne Terrace, Paddington, London
